item.title: India vs Australia 5th Test Day 1 LIVE Score: Pant, Jadeja fall in quick succession as Boland, Starc strike; IND 9 down - Hindustan Times
item.description:
India vs Australia 5th Test Day 1 LIVE Score

Date: January 3, 2025

Source: Hindustan Times

Rishabh Pant's innings ended at 40 runs as he fell to Scott Boland in a critical phase of the match, leading India to struggle against a strong Australian bowling attack. Following Pant, Nitish Kumar Reddy was dismissed for a golden duck, leaving India in a precarious position during Day 1 of the 5th Test at the SCG.

  • India lost Rishabh Pant after he scored 40 runs off 98 balls.
  • Scott Boland dismissed two key players in quick succession, continuing to challenge India's batting order.
  • The partnership between Pant and Jadeja was notable for its defensive approach, yielding only 35 runs in 111 balls.
  • Virat Kohli and other openers struggled against Australia's bowlers, raising concerns about the team's batting form.
  • India finished the day with 9 wickets down, struggling to maintain a competitive score.
“Pant’s innings was marked by grit but ultimately succumbed to the intense pressure of the Aussie bowlers.”

As the match progresses, India must respond strategically to avoid losing further wickets against a formidable Australian bowling lineup.

item.title: Quadrantid Meteor Shower 2025: When, Where And How To Watch The Year's First Shooting Stars In India - Times Now
item.description:
Quadrantid Meteor Shower 2025: When, Where And How To Watch The Year's First Shooting Stars In India

Publication Date: Not specified Source: Not specified

As 2025 rolls in, skywatchers will witness another dazzling shower, the Quadrantids meteor shower, lighting up the night sky. This annual spectacle of bright, colourful fireballs is known to be one of the most spectacular meteor showers of the year.

  • The Quadrantid meteor shower is active from December 26, 2024, to January 16, 2025.
  • The peak occurs on January 4, 2025, with up to 120 meteors per hour.
  • Best viewing in India is from the night of January 3 to early January 4, with peak intensity around 11:15 PM IST.
  • Ideal viewing locations are remote areas with minimal light pollution.
  • Meteors are best viewed lying on your back, facing northeast.
“The meteors are characterised by bright streaks of light flashing across the sky with a bang.”

This year’s Quadrantid meteor shower promises an unforgettable experience for skywatchers, particularly in India where viewers should prepare in remote spots for optimal viewing conditions.

item.title: From startup founders to athletes: How India’s angel investor landscape is evolving beyond wealthy individuals | Mint - Mint
item.description:
From startup founders to athletes: How India’s angel investor landscape is evolving beyond wealthy individuals

Publication Date: [Insert Date] Source: Mint

As traditional big-name founders in India’s startup ecosystem reduce their investments, a new class of angel investors, including athletes and young professionals, are emerging in the angel investment landscape.

  • The top three angel investors of 2023 have pulled back from funding in 2024.
  • Athletes are increasingly participating in early-stage funding.
  • This shift reflects a broader trend in the investment landscape in India.
"Sport stars, actors and young professionals are edging their way into angel investment territory"

This evolution in the angel investment landscape highlights changing dynamics in funding sources for startups in India.

item.title: PM Modis most expensive gift to Jill Biden, any guesses what could it be? - The Tribune India
item.description:
Jill Biden Receives Most Expensive Gift in 2023: A $20,000 Diamond from Modi

Publication Date: 2023, Source: The Tribune

President Joe Biden and his family received numerous gifts from foreign leaders in 2023, with Jill Biden receiving the most valuable present: a diamond worth $20,000 from Indian Prime Minister Narendra Modi.

  • The diamond is a 7.5-carat gem retained for official use.
  • Other notable gifts included a $14,063 brooch from the Ukrainian ambassador and a $4,510 set from Egypt's president.
  • Federal law mandates declaration of gifts over $480 received by executive officials.
  • CIA employees reported destruction of luxury gifts totaling over $132,000.
“Many of the gifts that meet that threshold are relatively modest.”

In summary, the gifting of expensive items by foreign leaders to the U.S. first family is regulated, yet it sparks significant interest due to the extensive values involved.

item.title: Meghan Markle, Prince Harry 'under pressure' after failed Netflix shows: 'They were paid an exorbitant amount of money' - Hindustan Times
item.description:
Meghan Markle and Prince Harry Face Pressure After Netflix Project Failures

Date: Jan 03, 2025 Source: Hindustan Times

Meghan Markle and Prince Harry's entry into content creation has faced challenges as their initial Netflix projects have not achieved significant viewership, prompting concerns from the streaming service.

  • The couple's Netflix projects, including the documentary Polo, have failed to attract an audience.
  • They reportedly received a significant amount of money for these projects, raising expectations.
  • Harry's passion for Polo has not resonated with viewers, leading to frustration about the project's reception.
  • Despite the initial success of their 2022 documentary, their subsequent work has struggled to gain traction.
  • Meghan has announced a new cooking and lifestyle show, set to premiere on January 15, which aims to revitalize their Netflix presence.
“Fact is, Harry and Meghan were paid an exorbitant amount of money by Netflix and have little to show for it. Whether they admit it or not, the pressure is on for the Sussexes to deliver a hit.”

This latest challenge highlights the pressures faced by Harry and Meghan as they navigate the competitive world of entertainment while trying to regain momentum with their upcoming projects.

item.title: OnePlus 13 cases leak hints at MagSafe like features and fresh materials - India Today
item.description:
OnePlus 13 Cases Leak Hints at MagSafe-like Features and Fresh Materials

Published On: Jan 3, 2025 | Published By: Aman Rashid

The upcoming OnePlus 13 series is set to launch globally on January 7, 2025, showcasing fresh accessories that feature magnetic capabilities, akin to Apple's MagSafe technology, and are compatible with Qi2 wireless charging.

  • OnePlus 13 will launch globally after initial release in China.
  • The series includes magnetic cases that can attach easily and work with various magnetic accessories.
  • Materials used for the cases will be Sandstone, Aramid Fiber, and Wood Grain, familiar to OnePlus fans.
  • These cases will offer compatibility with Qi2 chargers for an efficient charging experience.
  • The introduction of magnetic features represents a shift in the Android accessory market to catch up with Apple's innovations.
“It’s interesting to see how the Android world is catching up with Apple’s MagSafe.”

This new development from OnePlus reflects a growing trend in advanced smartphone accessories, enhancing user convenience and compatibility across devices.

item.title: Delhi Air Travellers Stuck As Dense Fog Hits Flight Ops; Cold Wave Grips North India - News18
item.description:
Delhi Air Travellers Stuck As Dense Fog Hits Flight Ops; Cold Wave Grips North India

Last Updated: January 03, 2025, 14:42 IST

Dense fog has enveloped Delhi, causing potential flight delays and disruptions at the airport due to adverse weather conditions as a cold wave continues to affect North India.

  • Delhi Airport has issued an advisory about possible delays in flight operations.
  • Passengers are advised to contact their airlines for updates on flight statuses.
  • SpiceJet has alerted passengers about potential flight disruptions due to bad weather.
  • Train services are also affected with at least 24 trains running late across North India.
  • Schools in Noida to be closed for classes up to 8 due to the cold wave.
“Due to bad weather in Delhi (DEL), all departures/arrivals and their consequential flights might get affected. Passengers are requested to keep a check on their flight status.” - SpiceJet

The dense fog is expected to persist, with the India Meteorological Department warning of continued severe weather conditions in the region.

item.title: India vs Australia LIVE, 5th Test, Day 1: Kohli's Offside Demons Haunt Again, Pant Hit On Helmet - NDTV Sports
item.description:
India vs Australia LIVE Score, 5th Test, Day 1: Rishabh Pant Takes Blows To Body, Steers India To 107/4 At Tea vs Aus

Date: January 3, 2025 Source: NDTV Sports

Amid criticism, Rishabh Pant coped several blows to his body, steering India to 107/4 at Tea on Day 1 of the 5th Test against Australia in Sydney. Pant was unbeaten on 32 off 80 balls while Jadeja was batting alongside him on 50.

  • India suffered a significant blow with Virat Kohli's dismissal, caught in the slips.
  • At the end of the first session, India lost Shubman Gill on the final delivery.
  • KL Rahul and Yashasvi Jaiswal also fell cheaply for India.
  • Scott Boland emerged as the standout bowler for Australia, taking two wickets.
  • @Jasprit Bumrah was acting captain in place of @Rohit Sharma who opted out of the match.
“It's a tough situation for India right now as they have lost key wickets early on.”

As the day progresses, the focus remains on how Pant and Jadeja can build a stronger partnership to recover the innings.

item.title: Avenue Supermarts shares skyrocket 15% as company's revenue in Q3 surges 17.5% YoY; check other details - Upstox
item.description:
Avenue Supermarts Shares Surge 15% Following Strong Q3 Revenue Growth

Date: January 3, 2025

Source: PTI

Avenue Supermarts, operators of DMart, saw a 15% increase in share prices after announcing significant revenue growth for Q3 FY25.

  • Shares rose to ₹4,152.75 on the NSE.
  • Standalone revenue for Q3 FY25 was ₹15,565.23 crore, up 17.49% YoY.
  • Total number of stores increased to 387 with 10 new additions this quarter.
“Overall, H1 FY 2025 like-for-like revenue growth was 7.4% for 2 years and older stores.” - Neville Noronha, CEO & Managing Director

This robust growth reflects Avenue Supermarts' strong market presence and operational success, indicating positive trends in the retail sector.

item.title: Plane crashes into Southern California building: 2 killed, 18 injured - The Times of India
item.description:
Plane crashes into southern California building: 2 killed, 18 injured

Publication Date: January 1, 2025 Source: Times of India

A tragic plane crash occurred in southern California, resulting in two fatalities and at least 18 injuries. The incident involved a small aircraft that crashed into a building in a densely populated area.

  • The crash took place shortly after takeoff.
  • Witnesses reported seeing flames and smoke rising from the building.
  • Emergency services responded promptly, and victims were transported to local hospitals.
“It all happened so quickly; the plane was up and then it just came down,” said a local resident who witnessed the incident.

This devastating event highlights the ongoing concerns regarding air safety and the potential risks of flying in densely populated areas.

item.title: Drama at SCG! Nervous Rohit Sharma jumps out of his seat for Virat Kohli’s golden duck call - The Times of India
item.description:
Drama at SCG! Nervous Rohit Sharma jumps out of his seat for Virat Kohli’s golden duck call

Publication Date: None available Source: Times of India

The SCG Test witnessed heightened tension when a controversial umpiring decision kept Virat Kohli in the game after he survived a golden duck on his first ball.

  • Kohli's near dismissal: Kohli faced a delivery from Scott Boland that seemed to edge through to slips.
  • Umpire's decision: TV umpire Joel Wilson ruled Kohli not out after reviewing footage.
  • Rohit's tension: Rohit Sharma, sitting out this match, displayed visible nerves as he watched Kohli's fate unfold.
  • Impact on the match: The incident added to the competitiveness of the Test match.
“Once the decision came through in Kohli’s favour, Rohit finally sat back, appearing more at ease.”

This moment of drama highlights the high stakes of Test cricket and the emotional investment of players, even those not on the field.

item.title: Human Metapneumovirus: After Coranvirus, mysterious virus HMPV reported in China| Know symptoms, preventive measures | Mint - Mint
item.description:
Human Metapneumovirus: After Coranvirus, mysterious virus HMPV reported in China| Know symptoms, preventive measures

Publication Date: Not specified Source: Live Mint

A surge in infections caused by human metapneumovirus (HMPV) has been reported in China as the administration steps up screening, detection, and isolation protocols to deal with unknown pathogens.

  • China has reported rising cases of HMPV, especially among those under 14 in northern provinces.
  • The government is piloting a monitoring system for pneumonia of unknown origin to prevent situations like those during the COVID-19 outbreak.
  • HMPV can cause upper and lower respiratory diseases, affecting people of all ages, but young children, older adults, and those with weak immune systems are particularly vulnerable.
  • Symptoms include cough, fever, nasal congestion, and shortness of breath, which may lead to bronchitis or pneumonia.
  • Prevention measures include washing hands, maintaining distance from infected individuals, and isolating when symptomatic.
  • Currently, there is no specific antiviral treatment or vaccine available for HMPV.
“Wash hands with soap whenever you come home. Avoid touching eyes, nose, or mouth with unwashed hands.”

The surge in HMPV cases highlights the need for heightened vigilance and preparedness in dealing with respiratory viruses in China.

All We Imagine As Light, a critically acclaimed film by Payal Kapadia, won the Grand Prix at the Cannes Film Festival and is now available for streaming.

  • The film was released in India on November 22, 2024.
  • Streaming on Disney+ Hotstar, presented in its original Malayalam language.
  • Highlights the lives of two Malayali nurses in Mumbai.

“The OTT response to this unique cinematic piece is eagerly anticipated.”

This film is set to engage audiences with its distinctive storytelling and performances.

item.title: Viral videos of crowded hospitals from China trigger speculation of HMPV outbreak - Hindustan Times
item.description:
Viral videos of crowded hospitals from China trigger speculation of HMPV outbreak

Date: Jan 03, 2025 Source: Hindustan Times

Videos on social media appear to show hospitals in China overwhelmed by the outbreak of human metapneumovirus (HMPV) and other viruses, raising fears of a potential new pandemic.

  • Multiple virus outbreaks, including HMPV, influenza A, and Covid-19, reportedly have left hospitals crowded.
  • No credible reports confirm the existence of a new pandemic, and health authorities, including the WHO, have not issued any warnings.
  • Viral videos depict hospitals with patients in crowded waiting areas, prompting comparisons to past COVID-19 surges.
“Hospitals in China are overwhelmed as outbreaks of 'influenza A' and 'human metapneumovirus' resemble the COVID-19 surge from three years ago.”

While concern grows, it remains crucial to seek reliable information before jumping to conclusions about a new health crisis.

item.title: New epidemic in China? Alarming videos show hospitals overwhelmed due to HMPV outbreak - Hindustan Times
item.description:
Alarming Videos Show Overwhelmed Hospitals in China Amid HMPV Outbreak

Date: Jan 03, 2025 Source: Hindustan Times

Alarming videos that have emerged on social media appear to show hospitals in China overwhelmed by the outbreak of human metapneumovirus (HMPV). Social media posts suggest that multiple virus outbreaks have left hospitals and cemeteries overcrowded.

  • New outbreak of HMPV reported in China.
  • Social media shows overwhelmed hospitals, reminiscent of COVID-19 surge.
  • No official confirmation of a new pandemic from Chinese health authorities or WHO.
  • HMPV primarily affects young children, the elderly, and immunocompromised individuals.
  • Symptoms of HMPV include cough, fever, and nasal congestion.
No credible reports confirm overwhelming hospital conditions caused by HMPV.

The emergence of HMPV has raised concerns, but health agencies have not declared an emergency, emphasizing the need for accurate information amidst panic.

item.title: Chosen for Khel Ratna honour, Gukesh promises best moves in future as well - The Hindu
item.description:
Gukesh Vows to Deliver Best Moves After Winning Khel Ratna Award

Date: January 03, 2025 Source: The Hindu

Chess world champion D Gukesh has been awarded the prestigious 'Khel Ratna' honour and has promised to deliver his best moves both on the chessboard and beyond.

  • Gukesh is the youngest-ever world champion, having recently defeated Ding Liren.
  • This award recognizes his achievements alongside shooter Manu Bhaker, hockey captain Harmanpreet Singh, and para-athlete Praveen Kumar.
  • He expressed gratitude to Prime Minister Modi for his inspiration and support.
  • The young player has ended Viswanathan Anand's long-standing top status among Indian chess players.
“I promise to continue delivering my best moves on 64 squares and outside of it.” — Gukesh D

The Khel Ratna award is the highest sporting honour in India, reflecting Gukesh's significant accomplishments in chess.

item.title: 'Our captain has shown leadership': What Jasprit Bumrah said about Rohit Sharma not playing in Sydney - The Times of India
item.description:
'Our captain has shown leadership': What Jasprit Bumrah said about Rohit Sharma not playing in Sydney

Publication Date: January 2, 2025 | Source: Times of India

In a significant move for the Indian cricket team, Jasprit Bumrah, instead of Rohit Sharma, led the team for the toss during the fifth Test against Australia at Sydney Cricket Ground. Rohit has opted out to rest after struggling in recent matches.

  • Jasprit Bumrah won the toss and opted to bat first.
  • Shubman Gill replaced Rohit Sharma in the playing XI.
  • Bumrah acknowledged Rohit's leadership and unity in the team.
  • Rohit had a disappointing performance with just 31 runs in five innings.
  • In 2024, Rohit scored only 619 runs in 14 Tests, averaging 24.76.
  • Rohit has the second-lowest batting average for a touring captain in Australia (6.2).
“Our captain has shown leadership, he has opted to rest. It shows the unity we have.” - Jasprit Bumrah

This decision allows Rohit to recover and gives a chance for other players to step up in crucial matches.

item.title: Indo Farm Equipment IPO allotment on January 3: Here’s how to check status on BSE and registrar website - CNBCTV18
item.description:
Indo Farm Equipment IPO allotment on January 3: Here’s how to check status on BSE and registrar website

Publication Date: January 2, 2024 — Source: CNBC TV18

How to Check Indo Farm Equipment IPO Allotment Status

Indo Farm Equipment Ltd. will finalize the allotment of its Initial Public Offering (IPO) on Friday, January 3. The company’s shares are scheduled to debut on the BSE and the National Stock Exchange (NSE) on January 7. The IPO, which opened for subscription from December 31 to January 2, witnessed robust demand, with an overall subscription of 227.57 times by the end of the final day.

  • The price band was set at ₹204-215 per share.
  • The Qualified Institutional Buyers (QIBs) segment was subscribed 242.40 times.
  • Non-Institutional Investors (NIIs) saw a subscription of 501.65 times.
  • Retail investors subscribed to their allocated portion 101.64 times.

Investors who bid for this mainboard issue can check the allotment status via the official websites of BSE, NSE, and the registrar. Shares will be credited to successful applicants' demat accounts on January 6, and refunds will be processed for those who did not receive allotments.

About Indo Farm Equipment

Indo Farm Equipment, founded in 1994, is a leading manufacturer of tractors and agricultural equipment, reporting ₹375 crore in revenue and ₹15.5 crore in net profit for fiscal year 2024.

item.title: "Selfless and secure Rohit Sharma did which other captains wouldn't have done": Legendary all-rounder hails star batter for opting out of the fifth Test - Crictoday
item.description:
“Selfless and secure Rohit Sharma did which other captains wouldn’t have done”

Published on: December 2024 | Source: Crictoday

Rohit Sharma's decision to opt out of the fifth Test against Australia has sparked discussion among cricket fans. His choice to prioritize team performance over individual presence, especially given his recent struggles with form, highlights his leadership qualities.

  • Rohit Sharma was struggling with form, prompting Shubman Gill's return to the playing XI.
  • India currently trails 1-2 in the Test series after four matches.
  • Irfan Pathan praised Rohit for making a selfless decision that is rare among captains.
  • The Indian team maintains secrecy regarding internal decisions, adding to the intrigue of Rohit's choice.
“It is better to leave if your batter is not able to do the talking. Rohit Sharma thought about the team and added a better player, Shubman Gill, to the Playing XI.” - Irfan Pathan

This decision bolsters Rohit Sharma's reputation as a secure and considerate leader, paving the way for team success over individual accolades.

item.title: Pushpa 2 India Box Office Day 28 (Early Trends): 50% Higher Than Pushpa 1 + Ala Vaikunthapurramuloo + Every Single Allu Arjun Film Since 2015! - Koimoi
item.description:
Pushpa 2 Box Office Day 28 (Early Trends): 50% Higher Than Pushpa 1 + Ala Vaikunthapurramuloo + Every Allu Arjun Film Since 2015!

Date: January 2, 2025 Source: Koimoi

Allu Arjun’s film, Pushpa 2, continues to dominate the box office as it celebrates its 28th day, with a total estimated collection of ₹1215 crore, surpassing the previous records held by Baahubali 2.

Key Points:

  • On Day 28, Pushpa 2 earned between ₹5.5 – 6 crore.
  • The film has grossed around ₹70 crore in its fourth week.
  • Pushpa 2's collection is 50% higher than the combined total of Allu Arjun's last seven films.
  • It was made on a budget of ₹500 crore, leading to a profit of ₹715 crore and a ROI of 143%.
“Pushpa 2’s box office collection of ₹1215 crore is 50% more than Ala Vaikunthapurramuloo and all other films by Allu Arjun.”

This remarkable performance underscores the film’s massive appeal and Allu Arjun’s growing star power in Indian cinema.

item.title: Bomb-making materials, an open Quran, and children's toys: Inside New Orleans terror attacker Shamsud-Din - The Times of India
item.description:
Inside the Home of New Orleans Terror Attacker Shamsud-Din Jabbar

Publication Date: October 29, 2023

Source: The Times-Picayune

A report details the shocking findings at Shamsud-Din Jabbar's residence, including bomb-making materials, an open Quran, and children's toys.

  • Federal agents discovered various bomb-making materials in Jabbar's home.
  • The presence of an open Quran raises questions about his motives and beliefs.
  • Children's toys found in the house highlight a disturbing contrast to the revealed terror-related items.
“This case raises significant concerns about domestic terrorism and the nature of radicalization.”

This incident underscores the potential for homegrown terror threats amidst ordinary surroundings.

item.title: Indian stock market: 8 key things that changed for market overnight - Gift Nifty, fall in Tesla shares to surging dollar | Stock Market News - Mint
item.description:
Indian stock market: 8 key things that changed for market overnight - Gift Nifty, fall in Tesla shares to surging dollar

Publication Date: January 5, 2024; Source: Mint

The Indian stock market's benchmark indices, Sensex and Nifty 50, are set to open lower due to mixed global cues following a strong performance the previous day.

  • The Sensex closed up 1,436.30 points at 79,943.71.
  • The Nifty 50 ended with a gain of 445.75 points, closing at 24,188.65.
  • Asian markets showed mixed results, with South Korea’s Kospi up 1.41%.
  • Tesla shares fell 6.1% after the company reported its first annual sales drop in over twelve years.
  • The US dollar index rose to a two-year high, reflecting strength in the labor market.
  • Gold prices increased slightly, driven by safe-haven demand.
  • Crude oil prices also rose, indicating ongoing supply concerns.
  • The overall market sentiment remains cautious amid concerns over US bond yields.
“While markets failed to deliver a Christmas rally over the past few weeks, the New Year has provided strong optimism in the first two days…” - Prashanth Tapse, Senior VP (Research), Mehta Equities Ltd.

This session highlights the current volatility in the equity markets prompted by global cues and domestic statistics.
